string.name: suggestTime
string.comment: Time that you suggest to your opponent to start a game

string.name: suggestDifferentTime
string.comment: Time to start a game that you want to suggest, if some time was already suggested

string.name: acceptSuggestedTime
string.comment: Accept time opponent suggested to start a game

string.name: xAcceptedTime
string.comment: Notification when player accepts suggested time

string.name: suggestedTime
string.comment: Currently suggested time to start a game

string.name: scheduledAt
string.comment: Date/time when game is scheduled for

string.name: myArrangedGames
string.comment: My arranged games from round-robin and organized tournaments

string.name: organized
string.comment: Tournament format - organized, players can only play games created by the organizer

string.name: existingGamesBetweenPlayers
string.comment: For tour organizers, title for a list of upcoming games between two selected players

string.name: pointsWDL
string.comment: points awarded for: W - win, D - draw, L - loss

resources.string: In a round-robin tournament, each player can play one game against every other player. Games don\'t start automatically - both players need to arrange the game and click \"%s\" to begin.
How do I play a game?

To play, click the correct cell in the table where you and your opponent meet. You can schedule a date and time for easy planning and a 24-hour reminder. The game starts only after both players click \"%s\".
You get 3 points for a win, 2 for a draw, and 1 for a loss. Every match counts toward your total score.
The player with the most points at the end wins. If players have the same number of points, the one who joined the tournament earlier is ranked higher.
In organized tournaments, only the tournament organizer can create matches between players. Players can then play those matches by clicking \"%s\".
The match starts when both players click \"%s\" - the players must start the game themselves. Organizer cannot start a game.
The organizer decides how many points are awarded for a win, draw, or loss.
